haefeleuser wrote:
> 
> Thank you, that helped me!
> 
> The pattern id described on the JUnit homepage.
> 
> Normally I have to pass a time object into a constructor according to
> this pattern. But I had to pass it as a parameter since the method
> which uses the time runs in a stateless session bean. They suffer
> because of Alzheimer's disease.
> 
> It even improved functionality, not just testability.

That usually happens.

> My original idea to modify the system time is thus not necessary. The
> Virtual Clock Pattern is easier and more robust.

I'm glad it helped.
